website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive wireless doorbell that comes with your choice of 3 different tones and 3 unique visual alert icons.
pros: You can set it up to work with 3 transmitters (ships with one)
3 chime tones to choose from, as well as 3 visual alert icons
Transmitter includes a feedback LED, so you can tell when it has been pushed
cons: Some buyers claim the range here is poor, or that this model stops working completely within a few months

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and reliable after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this at the service desk of our business for times when traffic is slow ("press button for service"). Over 3 years it has endured much more use and abuse than it would in a residential application. The button is pressed about 15 times a day and the chime unit gets passed from hand to hand every hour to the on-call person. We have not yet had to replace the battery in the button unit and I think we have only replaced the batteries in the chime unit once. Range is good enough that we can carry the chime unit anywhere in our three story, 24,000 square foot, concrete and steel building.
customer_reviews.author: Pralite Monk

customer_reviews.title: Bleh - should have lasted longer than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this unit 3 starts - if I could give it 2 1.2 I would. I bought the unit 2 years ago (2015) and other than changing the batteries once in that time, the unit has worked. However, recently (2017) it stopped working. I changed the batteries in both the chime and the push and it wouldn't reprogram. I was hoping this would last longer than 2 years and since it did actually work for 2 years is the reason the review is getting 3 starts (2 1/2 really)
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: Great Doorbell IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Well, at last, a wireless doorbell that really works, there is a few minor issue but nothing one cannot expect. Pro, easy, easy setup. Con batteries, knowing when to change the batteries. I recommend that you write down the date you installed the doorbell and replace the batteries every 6 months. The push button takes the small disc type batteries the ringer take 3 AA batteries. Great product for those who don't want to spend a lot of money on traditional old fashion type door bells. My doorbell had stopped working after a remodel of my home. Well, after all, ​it was 48 years old.
customer_reviews.author: billhigh67

customer_reviews.title: Loud and Clear
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy with this door bell! Our wired door bell stopped working. It's not the button but we need to call out a professional to replace the box. Instead I opted to purchase this. Installation for the button and the chime was around 15 minutes and just a couple of screws. I like the fact that it has multiple sounds to choose from and it is Very Loud. We keep out volume setting at midway as the loudest setting scares the kids. The chime unit also looks very nice and modern. I have these for 4 months so far and have not had to replace batteries yet. Still loud and clear. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny D.

customer_reviews.title: Wired doorbell replacement
customer_reviews.text: Our very old but expensive wired doorbell went out years ago. It was on my 'to do' list for years but never seemed to be the priority thing. I got tired of no doorbell so decided to get a wireless, at least for temporary use. You can get cheap ones, but they sound cheap. I decided to get this one, Honeywell being a good brand and reviews being great. Well, I'm glad I got it. It sounds just like the original doorbell. Installation should normally be easy for anybody. I wouldn't hesitate to get another one if the need came about.
customer_reviews.author: kruisinkat

customer_reviews.title: Great bell because it uses 3 AA batteries, can be carried to deck or garage and has a rubber button that won't crack in the cold
customer_reviews.text: Nice doorbell. I love 3 things about it. First, it uses 3 AA cell batteries whereas our old one used 3 D cell batteries. I have tons of AA rechargeable batteries so this is perfect. Second, I love that it has a wall plate with 2 hooks that you can hang the unit on. This makes it easy to take to the garage or out on the deck if you are expecting a package especially one that you have to sign for. Third, the outdoor bell button has a rubber button. This is good since our old button had a hard plastic cover that eventually cracked. 3 simple tones so don't expect a symphony or holiday jingles. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mauge

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the older built thick plaster walls home without having to get an electrician in to put in wiring for bell.
customer_reviews.text: We live in an old pre ww2 home. No closets, and no door bell. The lack of closets was easily solved with amoirs. Not so easy to solve the door bell problem. After a lot of hopeful tries, none of which carried thru thick walls or could be heard outside the room the receiver was placed. this honeywell wireless is the one we love. We placed the receiver in central location in the house and we can hear it both upstairs and down. No more missed visitors who bang on door and aren’t heard.
customer_reviews.author: Odie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Price, Value & Easy Installation
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Easy to install, easy to program, the chime selections are nice as well. I installed the receiving box behind curtains on our front living room wall below the picture window so distance from the front door made no difference. The house has siding but I'm sure this would work fine through any surface. I purchased an additional button for the attached garage service door and it too works perfect and I was able to program a different chime for it.
customer_reviews.author: Don Anastas

customer_reviews.title: Finally a wireless doorbell that works!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a wireless doorbell that works. Is easy to set up! I am thrilled with this. I have called handymen and electricians that gave me no help. I had another brand and it lasted about a year. I put in the battery, set this up and programmed with an additional push button I also ordered from Amazon and It is great. I am so happy when I walk by the door I have to ring it because I can't believe I have one that finally works. My house was built in the 30's and is about 1600 square feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still chiming
customer_reviews.text: Now in year five, it's been working as it should. The batteries seem to last a couple of years and both the chime and loudness can be adjusted. At its loudest setting, we can hear it all over the house. Since it is wireless, the receiver can be placed anywhere, on the wall, a shelf or corner. The outdoor sending unit is ordinary plastic and could be a bit more decorative.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!!!
customer_reviews.text: My house is 2,000 sq feet plus and I didn't always hear the knock @ the door, so I started searching for an "easy to install" door bell as I would have to install myself. I put the base (for the lack of a better word) in like the center part of the house and I can hear it any where in the house. The unit also has different sounds to choose from, which was a plus. I found everything I was in need of it in this product and would not only recommend to others, but would purchase again myself!
customer_reviews.author: Lady V in NC

customer_reviews.title: 6 months and it's dead. Junk
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 6 months or so. Now I can't get it to do anything. Our friends bought the same one and there's doesn't work either. We both had a good laugh about how we wasted our money on this doorbell.
customer_reviews.author: JwB

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks!! It sounds awful but most of all it burns through batteries like crazy!! I don’t get many people at my door, an Amazon package now and then, it seems every time I am wait on someone or something the bell never rings!! I check it and it’s dead!! I change the batteries and it works again until someone tries to use it, then it’s dead again!! What’s the point?! Don’t buy it, it’s crap!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: The chime is stylish, but Honeywell chintzed out with ...
customer_reviews.text: The chime is stylish, but Honeywell chintzed out with the included doorbell. Honeywell makes a doorbell that actually matches the chime design (metallic accents with black ABS plastic), but they insist on selling it as a separate option... greedy bastards! That said, the unit works well, is idiot-proof, and is loud as hell. I can't comment on the range as I keep the unit only 15 feet from the doorbell with minimal wall interference. I wish Honeywell would include the matching doorbell as a unit instead of forcing us to buy it separately.
customer_reviews.author: Skeletor

customer_reviews.title: What a great product
customer_reviews.text: What a great product. This wireless portable chime can be actuated using the remote from inside or outside the house. I have found that it works well at long distances. I personally use it to summon my gamer son to dinner. This eliminates the need to yell at the top of my lungs to get his attention. This has gone a long way towards restoring serenity to our humble home.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Green

customer_reviews.title: Yet another piece of cheap Chinese junk from a formerly great manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Bell is loud & clear, instructions are in English, attractive & seemingly durable case, easy to program. However, this is not your granddad's Honeywell. One of two units stopped working after 2 years. Yes i replaced batteries. Like their PIR driveway annunicator, this is cheap Chinese junk. The company used to be a premium brand--back in the day.
customer_reviews.author: TheMatrix

customer_reviews.title: The Honeywell was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new doorbell when I murdered my old one during a major electric storm when it wouldn't stop going off. This one is so much nicer. Even the tone is more enjoyable that Big Ben chime I had in the old one. The Honeywell was easy to install. I have had no problems with it, even during electrical storms. Yahoo! If you want a doorbell that works without scaring the bejeebers out of you every time someone pushes it or one that doesn't go off every couple of minutes during an electrical storm, this Honeywell Premium Portable doorbell one to consider.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Convenient. Highly Recommend Particularly for Those with Moderate Hearing Deficit
customer_reviews.text: My hearing loss has meant missing the (old) doorbell frequently, because it's uncontrollable tones and volume fell in my deficit's range. This doorbell beautifully solves that for me with portability of the sounding device (that big rectangle) that I can take with me to various parts of my home and, as significantly, with its volume control and a blinking icon that lights for a few seconds after the doorbell has ceased to visually confirm what I've thought I've heard.
customer_reviews.author: LuvGreatGlass

customer_reviews.title: Handy being able to place doorbell wherever I want it so I can hear it
customer_reviews.text: The battery life has been good. I can place it in my bedroom so that I can hear the door in our long ranch house. If I am out at the patio then I can move it to a new location. Bought this before the Ring became super popular so this might be outdated, but I still like it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Nice sounding door bell
customer_reviews.text: The chime unit looks good and can be wall mounted or not. It would sit on a table just fine. It has several light indicators to show which door button is being pressed. I would give it five stars if it were a little louder.
customer_reviews.author: T. E.

customer_reviews.title: Great working & looking Doorbell System with the hassel of rewiring!
customer_reviews.text: Love this doorbell system. We did buy the extra push button for our back door. Price is reasonable. Not cheap but well priced. We bought another similar product from the HDepot,which quit after only months later.. This Amazon Product "Honeywell" is a well known label and really an excellent working product. I would recommend this system to anyone who needs a doorbell system without the hassel of rewiring.
customer_reviews.author: Mary929W

customer_reviews.title: The bell sound is adjustable but we keep it nice and loud
customer_reviews.text: I got this doorbell to put in our upstairs bonus room. My husband uses it for various hobbies and he cannot hear me if I call him. I keep the doorbell button mounted on a piece of plexiglass the size of a light switch cover. It usually sits in the remote control caddy on the coffee table. It will ring the upstairs bell from every room in the house. Having it mounted makes less likely to get misplaced. Also it is portable so if for any reason I need to take it to other rooms I can. The bell sound is adjustable but we keep it nice and loud.
customer_reviews.author: DKP

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Have used for over 5+ years. No complaints. Sounds great. Max distance tried is 40 ft, worked without hiccup. It has multiple sounds to choose and the volume as well. More than one push button can be added. The max volume is too high for our house. We never wall mounted. Just left it in a hidden place.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Finally a doorbell that works in cold climates
customer_reviews.text: I've had several wireless doorbells since my house did not have a wired one installed. I think this is finally the one that is going to make it. I live in a cold climate (temperatures well below zero not unusual in Jan/Feb) and the others have stopped working during the winter. This one has made it through the winter and continued functioning. It has a loud chime and I can easily take it off the wall bracket if I'm going to be in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Badidas

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant sound and very reliable wireless doorbell
customer_reviews.text: Love this door bell. I use it with a 30 foot distance from the doorbell to the ringer at the gate. I made one mistake however, I installed the doorbell where the sun hits it all day long in the summer. The sunlight damaged the plastic on the doorbell button. I should have provided shade for the button. I am so satisfied with this product that I just bought another one just like it but I will shade the ringer when I install it this time.
customer_reviews.author: South America

customer_reviews.title: Tons of FAKE REVIEWS - Did Not Transmit Signal Over 10 Feet
customer_reviews.text: Would not work if the transmitter was more then 10 feet away from the base (that was even in direct sight). Don't even think about having it transmit through a wall or two. Through amazon, I was able to get a replacement sent - same issue. Had to return both bases and the extra transmitter. * Would not buy - with this many positive reviews and having to try two different devices, both having the same issue - makes you wonder how this product can have such a high rating?
customer_reviews.author: MIke

customer_reviews.title: I think it is an EXCELLENT product. If this is something you need I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've bought one of these. I think it is an EXCELLENT product. If this is something you need I absolutely recommend this and I like the fact that I can carry the bell with me if I'm likely to be somewhere in the house where I might now hear it, if I didn't have it with me. The only problem is getting people to use the doorbell. Especially delivery men from the 2 major firms, they like to creep to the door, drop your package and run away. Workmen will knock on the door, I'm not sure what people think a doorbell is for. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: TDRAGON

customer_reviews.title: So we opted for this wireless doorbell instead and couldn't be happier. It has a great range
customer_reviews.text: This is a convenient system. After our doorbell inexplicably stopped working, we found out the wiring was done for and we needed to replace the entire electrical system. So we opted for this wireless doorbell instead and couldn't be happier. It has a great range, can be programmed for different doors in the same house, and has three different chimes. It is loud enough to hear even in our laundry room with the machines running and works outside even in our frigid, North Dakota winter temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: JPinchette

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Simple installation. Bought it for the office. We keep the front door locked to keep people from wandering in. The office is metal framed studs and the box is mounted just inside the door. The push button is mounted on the metal door frame. Typical metal and glass door you would find in most business suites. The chime is loud enough (the volume is easily adjusted) to be heard through out the office. Not sure how many square feet, but consist of reception area, lunch room, bathroom, small kitchen, conference room and four offices, file storage room and open work area for mail machine, file cabinets, etc. in a shot-gun arrangement. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: TXJalapeno

customer_reviews.title: 6 years later and still working
customer_reviews.text: I've had this since 2010 - still working. The 'push button' is located on the gate post all the way in front of the house, we had to move the 'chime box' a bit closer to the front of the house in order for it to work. Other than that it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Life is good

customer_reviews.title: It Awakens You
customer_reviews.text: It works fine and the range is extremely good. It's been years since I had a door-chime as my transformer cashed in long ago. I relied on a door knocker but lately (my hearing) that hasn't been acceptable. This unit was inexpensive, simple to install and solved my problem completely. The push-button is approximately 25 feet from the chime unit now but was effective much further away. I gave it all five for one very important item: The sending unit (yeah, that button assembly) uses AAA batteries which can be easily obtained anywhere. I get completely turned off any item that uses 'special' overpriced batteries unnecessarily from a design point.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: A quality product at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Delighted. Exactly what we wanted. Took about 15 minutes to install, but it was fairly easy. I just used a Phillips screwdriver. You may be able to just stick it on to your exterior wall with the sticky kit, but I had to use the screw kit. We love the sound. Very English and proper you know! We just set the inside unit on a book case. The volume is adjustable, which is nice and you have your choice of several tunes. Our UPS guy likes it much better than what we had before. Ha Ha!! So do we. Jim A.
customer_reviews.author: Jim A.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, until it stopped working. A little after one year, this doorbell no longer rings consistently when pressed. The button is installed about 30 feet from the soundbox, separated by a thin wooden door. Tried new batteries in both the button and box, no change. A doorbell that works sometimes is actually WORSE than no doorbell at all. People think it's working, press it several times, and then leave, thinking you're not home. Terribly inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T.

customer_reviews.title: This doorbell was amazingly easy to install and changing the chime and volume was ...
customer_reviews.text: This doorbell was amazingly easy to install and changing the chime and volume was easy as well with the product book. I like the sound and it can be heard from any room. The cost was reasonable and better than the big box store where I first saw it. No electrical knowledge is necessary since it is a wireless doorbell. The battery is a coin-shaped battery that is readily available and simple to replace. It has a fairly small footprint and installs just about anywhere. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: T. Malone

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: ever have someone ill and in another room of the house - but you need to get work done? someone who has impaired strength and whose voice you may not hear? that is how we used this doorbell - for mom - and after mom, gave it to a freind who had cancer - her and her husband used it the same way you cannot go wrong
customer_reviews.author: als.josh

customer_reviews.title: I hope the second purchase, of this bell, is better than the first.
customer_reviews.text: The bell works OK, but this ky second one. The first was purchased three years ago. It died, after year three and I changed the battery. Unfortunately it was not the battery and Honeywell said it's out of wattanty and there is no way to fix it. If in warrant, they replace it. So, I'm giving it another try, but a three life is not as good as the battery life, which still had a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: There are many reviews discussing the pros and cons of this - and maybe in some peoples homes there are some issues about the distance it can function. I took these to heart and installed the batteries in both the transmitter (button) and received (chime), then I placed the chime in the approximate final location and walked around the area where I wanted to install the button. It works flawlessly. I also experimented with keeping the button in the final location and moving the chime further and further away in the house - it worked more then sufficiently at twice the distance of the final chime location. Overall this is a great replacement to a faulty doorbell.
customer_reviews.author: Aynsley

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.text: I could have traced the wiring through an attic currently running at a killing 140 degrees, OR I could buy a simple digital, wireless door chime. Guess which I decided upon. Super simple to program and mount, bought an extra button for the back door and it is all good. I didn't die a desiccated corpse in my summer Southern attic and I know when the UPS man arrives with my next box from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless doorbell
customer_reviews.text: This is our third wireless door chime but the first one that works well. ( The first two were no name brands from the home center that were inexpensive and worked just that well.) It offers flexibility in being able to be used with multiple door bells (eg a front and a back door) and allows the user to set a unique sound for either bell. The number one criteria for us is the volume control. With this chime's volume set to medium, we can hear it everywhere in our 2000 square foot home. The ability to bring the chime outdoors on the deck when needed is a significant plus. We would purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: New Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in Honeywell- Shame on you Honeywell
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in Honeywell- Shame on you Honeywell. They must be getting their supplies from overseas. I installed the batteries, set the chimes, tested it and it worked great. Was very impressed by the style and how easy it was to set up. Nice looking. Drove 1/2 an hour to the house it was going to be installed in. Tested it 1 more time and it hasn't worked since. Tested both batteries, I don't know how something breaks in 1/2 hour.
customer_reviews.author: online shopper

customer_reviews.title: I read through almost every review of the best electric doorbells
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't stand the thought of hoping to hear knocking at the door & I didn't want to invest in wiring for a doorbell. This is just what I needed. I read through almost every review of the best electric doorbells. I must say, months after having this one, I am so pleased. I can hear this from everywhere in my house, & even if I'm out on the patio. It makes a difference where you locate the device. Make sure you try out different areas on the wall, as it relates to the structure underneath, to get the best sound.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Mine is temperamental despite the amazing reviews. Was working intermittently and i assumed it ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine is temperamental despite the amazing reviews. Was working intermittently and i assumed it was the batteries so i replaced in both devices but still ppl would press the doorbell and it wouldn't ring. I've moved them closer together and so far so good but they're about 15' apart and through a couple of doors now, not the 50' apart they were when it wasn't working, and nowhere near the advertised 250' range. Still it's way better than wiring a doorbell from scratch.
customer_reviews.author: ollyh

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: We needed a temporary doorbell when our wired one was being repaired. We hung the Honeywell below ours and used velcro strips to mount it. The Honeywell came with a mounting kit but as our need was temporary, we did not use it. The unit worked very well; range was good. We centrally located the chime so it could be heard throughout the house. For our purposes it worked very well. I liked the fact that it was wireless and can be taken anywhere. When our daughter moved to a rental house where the wired doorbell did not function, she used it too.
customer_reviews.author: momstehr

customer_reviews.title: Easy solution to the doorbell problem.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Works as advertised. Attractive and well-packaged, this product is easy to set up and install. Being wireless, you don't have to run any wires, and there's no transformer. But you do have to remember to change the batteries every couple of years or so. Installation hint: If you install this just above a door opening on a load-bearing wall, there should be a solid wood header behind the drywall that'll enable you to set the two mounting screws without using the plastic wall anchors that come with the product. Another good spot is above an exterior door. Same deal: There's a header behind the drywall.
customer_reviews.author: James Plante

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for our front and back door. We ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for our front and back door. We use two different chimes. 4 years and not an issue. We live in the NE with snow and humid summers. The door button is workng on the original batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works well for battery-operated device. Plenty loud. Receiver can be hung on wall, or laid on table. My receiver is located about 25 feet indoors from push button on outside door frame. The doorbell button can be attached with provided screws... it also appears it can be attached with self stick foam squares on clean smooth surface. I also installed the doorbell button upside down so I can easily access the tiny release button, take it apart, and replace large button-type battery when needed. My wife noticed the upside down installation, and she thought it would be easier to open and remove screws if we took doorbell with us if we move.
customer_reviews.author: geno03245

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Doorbell
customer_reviews.text: I installed this Honeywell Wireless Doorbell with very little effort. If you’re in the market for a system like this one then look no further. It’s been incredibly reliable and is well made. The price point was also great.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Gioia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Wireless Doorbell
customer_reviews.text: I bought this doorbell for summertime use so that we can hear someone at the front door when we are on the deck in the backyard. So far, it is working beautifully. With the volume control, we are able to hear the chime from anywhere in the yard (and I have a quarter acre). The base is not waterproof so I have mounted it over the door, under the eave. We have had a couple of rain storms already and so far it has stayed dry.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! battery operated doorbell system
customer_reviews.text: As a basic doorbell system this is excellent! I was able to coordinate 3 bells and ringer buttons put one in kitchen dinning area put one in living room area and one in basement each outside button location has a unique ring and a light up icon on inside unit lets me know which door people are at.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Elkins

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this unit!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this unit! It was always impossible to hear someone knocking at my front door, this has resolved that issue as the bell inside can be placed anywhere you need it to be since it is wireless. I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: June J. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a replacement - much better range and louder bell
customer_reviews.text: I purchased another brand of wireless doorbells about a year ago and was never happy with the intermittent reception. I have a covered front patio and the various deliverymen tend to leave my deliveries outside of the patio - not really desirable during the heat of an AZ summer with its merciless sun. While they generally ring the bell, my previous wireless doorbell only rang some of the time (there are two walls in between the button and the receiver unit). This one works much better and is louder to boot. Also the fact that it uses AA batteries instead of C batteries is a positive since I no longer have to keep C batteries on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jong S. Rho

customer_reviews.title: great product, affordable
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't feel like messing with the wiring in my house AGAIN. So instead, I got a wireless doorbell. Honeywell's products are as reliable as they were in the 70s, when my dad worked for them. I bought this thing with my own money, and I'm pleased to have it.
customer_reviews.author: shiversodread

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sound
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a home I'm selling easy install except the outside button I'm always seeing these buttons half attached to existing switch and looking badly so I purchased a metal switch plate that matched my new front porch lamp and removed the battery cover drilled small hole through each and attached with a small screw then screwed that to the existing switch outlet came out great and attached nice and tight no sloppy dodo spend a little extra time attaching the switch, eventually the double face tape will release
customer_reviews.author: jmath

customer_reviews.title: but not too bad.
customer_reviews.text: Finally a doorbell that works!!! We had an old doorbell that we constantly had to change the batteries in the bell and button. And the bell part needed 4 C batteries, who buys C batteries? Anyway I said forget it and got this one. There is only 3 ringtones, but that's OK. There is a volume dial that is really helpful. Setting up the ringtone you want is a little confusing, but not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Honeywell has done a great job here
customer_reviews.text: There are so many doorbells one can buy and over the years I have collected a bunch of them and they just don't work. Honeywell has done a great job here. Excellent range, loud, clear, I can add multiple button units with different sounds so I know if someone is at the front door vs the garage entrance.
customer_reviews.author: whywhy

customer_reviews.title: Honeywell RCWL300A1006 Premium Portable Wireless Door Chime and Push Button...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome products,.. I bought the extra button, this review for both the Honeywell RCWL300A1006 Premium Portable Wireless Door Chime and Push Button AND the Honeywell RPWL301A1006/A Decor Wireless Surface Mount Push Button. Easy to program the bell to the buttons (one included, bought an additional for the other door), program a different tone for each door. I've read reviews that say it's not loud enough... um, ya know there's a volume button under the black face plate, right? I turned mine up full blast just for s***s and giggles... I could hear it outside, doors closed, 50' away. Both button and chime work great, awesome product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: GolferSA

customer_reviews.title: Works great, super loud!
customer_reviews.text: This doorbell was just what I needed in my 80yr old brick house. I needed something that was reasonably priced, reliable, easy to install and so loud that I would be able to hear anywhere in my house - this doorbell certainly fits the bill! I bought an extra bell button for my side door, too. It was super easy to set up and it is ridiculously loud!! What's great is that I can bring this with me if I'm in my yard and always know when guests have arrived! Definitely would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: NSK

customer_reviews.title: Freaking Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: The Honeywell chime sounds loud and clear from EVERY room in the apartment -even the bathroom, which quite distant from the doorbell. I live on a 3rd floor apartment and to be able to carry this chime with me to all rooms and be assured it will work is a blessing. I changed chimes/doorbells 4 times in less than 2 years. None lasted much and the chimes had to stay in the master bedroom or they'd be out of range (and when the bedroom door was closed, I couldn't hear it). I'm so very happy with the Honeywell. I wish I had bought this one first and saved me some serious bucks!
customer_reviews.author: J. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Modernist and Functional
customer_reviews.text: After our office door intercom stopped working we needed a quick fix that could both be heard in a loud office and ideally seen as well in case the first or last person in the office was wearing headphones. This small wireless unit works quite well and provides both a loud doorbell sound and subtle blinking light when it rings. We place it on the desk of the first/last employee of the day so that they're sure to hear it. It's not pretty, but it's functional and rings even though the receiver is on the far side of a couple brick walls and 40 feet away. (Actually, it's rather ugly... but it works. And that's what we needed.)
customer_reviews.author: Tate Linden

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set Up
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this doorbell set to replace an older model, by a different manufacturer, that was starting to give false rings. The Honeywell unit was easy to set up and, I hope, is likely to resist spurious rings since each push-button transmitter has a unique signal that is "remembered" by the receiver. My old unit had many more tunes than this one, but three are enough for me and I like that they are selected on the console/receiver, rather than the doorbell/transmitter, so that visitors can't inadvertently change them/
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Marvin

customer_reviews.title: Good range, solid build
customer_reviews.text: Good range, solid build, easy to set up. My wife is somewhat of a stickler for authentic-sounding ring chimes that don't sound like an electronic greeting card on steroids or an '80s video game. The basic ding-dong chime is great -- good resonance, good tone, sounds plausibly like an actual bell chime. This is my favorite wireless doorbell, and I've bought a half-dozen of them.
customer_reviews.author: Better Yeti

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This has been working great for 6 months or so, replacing an older different brand that constantly needed new batteries. So far, no new batteries needed. The bell sounds good, and can be adjusted nice and loud to reach upstairs as well as downstairs. I'm very happy with it. ** UPDATE 11/21/12 ** After a year, this doorbell is still working great, on the original batteries I put in it when I bought it. ** UPDATE 10/24/16 ** This doorbell still works great, I think I did replace the batteries finally a while back, but the batteries last a very long time! I'm super happy with the quality of this doorbell, and the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Riley

customer_reviews.title: Finally a wireless doorbell that works!
customer_reviews.text: This Honewell package comes with one transmitter. I purchased a standalone, extra transmitter for side door (all on Amazon - great price). Main chime unit has a second chime sound should you pick-up a second transmitter as I did. A different chime for each door, no guessing which door to answer. There is a third button to work with, one that can be used with a remote to turn on lights. Very clever, handy. I only needed about 75ft. of 150ft says will work with. Chimes are not silly melodies. One is a standard sort of bright chime, the second is big-ben chime by default. Recommended, Ron
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Wireless to the rescue
customer_reviews.text: We built our new house and when it was almost completed, I discovered that there was no wiring for a doorbell. Duh! Luckily Amazon came to the rescue with this wireless door chime. It works fine, and I like the idea that the base unit is portable. With the loudest setting, there's no trouble hearing it throughout the house. No issues with interference with multiple wireless gadgets in the house. This is the best looking one I could find, but I wish there were a larger selection of styles.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler2000

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This portable door bell is an excellent product. It is well constructed and good looking. There are multiple settings for a preferred ring sound. While its first use could be intended as a back door bell, I have used this differently. My wife, who has health problems, carries the beeper and uses it as a remote warning aid should she need help. The ringer box is located in the hall way outside my home office and the volume settings allow the sound to be easily heard. I would recommentd this product for a variety of usages.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pavese

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant chimes beats someone banging on the side window next to front door.
customer_reviews.text: It was a pleasant purchase when I chose this item after being years listening to the 70's doorbell built into our front door. Since then, we had a security door installed and the only way visitors would knock on our door is either to bang annoying on the screen door or knock on the glass. With the wireless door chime, all these issues went away. Easy to mount the doorbell button and also can adjust the sound and select different tones to listen to. I opted not to mount this on the wall and decided to just place it over out kitchen countertop. Works either way. Can't go wrong with this one- great product!!
customer_reviews.author: RSC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, good sound
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much just pop in the batter and go. Only drawback here I found was the adhesive strip that allows for screw less mounting of the button slipped off within an hour or so. A newly remodeled house I was not thrilled at idea of screwing into the brand new composite siding...so still looking for alternative. Evidently the slightly glossy and wood textured surface of the trim is not conducive to letting the adhesive bond well enough. Considering these are always an outside mount I was disappointed to find the included strip failed so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: cityToCountry

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace a wired door chime that was kaput. Simply pulled the wired unit off the wall, capped the wires, and shoved them back into the wall and placed the new wireless unit over the hole. The Honeywell RCWL300A1006 Premium Portable is dirt simple to install and program. Volume is adjustable and there are three choices of chimes. Different chimes can easily be assigned to different buttons. Despite it's very compact size, the chimes are loud and clear. Don't hesitate to choose this product! It meets or exceeds all claims.
customer_reviews.author: PhilMT

customer_reviews.title: This door bell is so easy to set up and the chimes sound very nice
customer_reviews.text: This door bell is so easy to set up and the chimes sound very nice. I especially like that I can carry it around the house for those times I'm getting ready to go out in my bathroom with my music turned up loud. Haven't missed a guest yet. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, works well for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I like that the volume is adjustable, and it can get VERY loud. It has 3 chimes to choose from. If you mount it on a wall I would suggest using the provided mount rather than sticking it directly on the wall with double sided tape. The provided mount allows a small gap between the wall and the unit to better hear the chime. It is muffled and much softer if taped directly to the wall. My receiver is mounted just inside my front door so I can't attest to the range. I spray painted the doorbell black since it is outside, the white would show dirt very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Not for hard of hearing.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this doorbell for my hard-of-hearing 85 year old mother based on the reviews that the doorbell was very loud. Fortunately, before trying the product we tried it against her existing, 30 year old doorbell and found that the existing doorbell was just as loud. Neither doorbell could be heard over a loud television. The light on the doorbell is so dim, it cannot be seen more than five or six feet away from the doorbell and as such is not helpful in alerting the resident. May work for a small apartment, but did not work my mother’s small house.
customer_reviews.author: M. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Bell on the husband
customer_reviews.text: When I call my husband he says he couldn't hear me because a) the furnace was running, b) he was working with a power tool, c) he had just run out to the garage for something. (without telling me). I got tired of always trying to locate him and shouting with no response. SO---I bought THIS and ladies, it works perfectly. Nice and loud. When in his workroom or any other location where he claims he could not hear me, he now has the part that RINGS near him or in a pocket. His dear wife, ME, has the button to push to make the bell ring. Finding husband? SOVLED. Love this product. Well packaged and quickly arrived.
customer_reviews.author: F. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great little chime
customer_reviews.text: I live in a house with a wall around the property, and a gate that is some distance from the front door. Wiring a bell to the gate would be possible but quite inconvenient. The reason I bought this particular chime is because it claims a operational range greater than most on the market, and I needed the range. Training the push button to the chime is as simple as pushing a button on the base unit and then pressing the push button itself. While the Honeywell chime is a bit more expensive than others, the materials and apparent quality are well above average. Installation is a snap, and the operational range is more than adequate for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: G. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Get a new doorbell, already.
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised at how well this product works. Frankly, I was surprised, as I am a bit of a wiring fan. I wish that I lived in one of those homes with CAT-5 cabled throughout the house, so that my life did not depend on the vicissitudes of a wireless router. However, the product performs its duties well, is painless to install, and is reasonably solidly built. The appearance is contemporary and unobtrusive. Most importantly, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: We have a secured door between us and the reception area. if the receptionist is away people come in and press the button and the doorbell sounds in the back office where we are working. The standard bell couldn't be heard with the door closed and we don't want people just walking down the back hallway where our offices are located. It's great for after hours too when the front doors are locked. we fixed an extra remote to the outside so if people need in they can ring it and we can answer the door.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Swankosky

customer_reviews.title: Works great and simple installation.
customer_reviews.text: Took just a few minutes to get this working. Good directions and manual. I bought this because I don't hear well even with aid and I can hear this anywhere in the house and the yard turned all the way up. Three chimes although I didn't like but the one ding dong. The chime receives the signal from at least 50-60 feet away. I'd buy this again. Let's see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic door bells
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two sets of the doorbell as I needed two chimes, one for downstairs and another one for upstairs. I like the idea of having an extra door bell in case the one outside by my back door go bad in the future. The chimes works fantastic. We have it set up to chime short so we know it is someone at the back door. The front doorbell chime longer and it goes thru the intercom. I highly recommand the Honeywell RCWL300A10006 Premium Portable doorbells. Installing them was a breeze and so easy. Just follow the instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Finally found a wireless doorbell that works
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait a while before I reviewed this because I've had no luck with these things in the past. They'd work for a week or so then die. This unit has outlived them all and, despite a six foot fall from the wall when we were hanging a picture nearby, it's still working perfectly. I think the build quality on this is above the standards of the other wireless doorbell units out there. It just works. That's all I was looking for and so far I can't find anything to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scholz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: When we moved into our new (but very old home) the original doorbell drove us crazy with false alarms or no alarm at all when someone actually needed us to come to the door. The Honeywell fixed all those problems. The door buttons took two minutes to install and maybe five minutes to set the configuration on the alarm. We chose different signals for the front and rear doors, which was an easy option to configure. The alarm is loud and distinctive, no worries at all at missing a guest, candidate, or vacuum salesman. The alarm unit is also pretty stylish and came with multiple mounting options.
customer_reviews.author: Mr J.

customer_reviews.title: This one is much better. There are a few tones and the volume ...
customer_reviews.text: Works. I put it on top of my old doorbell that I could barely hear. This one is much better. There are a few tones and the volume can be adjusted. It is also very easy to take the doorbell and put it in a different place if needed. Basically: Stick or screw the button part where you want the button for the doorbell to be outside your door Put the doorbell where you want it to go, for me it was on top of my old doorbell. I turned it around so the speaker faces outward instead of the wall. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: This works great!!
customer_reviews.text: You know I wasn't too sure about this when my bell went out due to hurricane Sandy. This is an easily installed, simple to program device. The "chime" is a very small unit, about 4" x 6-7" and 1" thick. Very easily mounted on a wall, but, You will need to increase the volume of the bell if you do so. Not very much, its just the speaker is on the back of the base unit. The included mounting bracket is set to keep the unit about 1/4" away from the wall. I just stood it up on a table in the living room. Works for me!! Thanks Amazon for a great price and very fast shipping(3 days?)
customer_reviews.author: BobbyLee

customer_reviews.title: great bell
customer_reviews.text: put review on "extra" button. Great doorbell, good volume, love the light that shows which door, good range. Only suggested improvement would be to allow different ring for front and back doors.
customer_reviews.author: Groverjohn

customer_reviews.title: Wireless door chime by Honeywell
customer_reviews.text: Received this wireless doorbell maybe 5 days after ordering it for an apt. that is being remodeled. Since the old doorbell had been removed, we needed something to alert us to deliveries, etc. There are two entrances, so I ordered an extra Push button for the second door which rings with a different bell sound to let us know where the visitor is located. It was easy to set up and program and I would recommend it. It is not a very fancy push button, but works. The wireless feature also be helpful for those hard of hearing as this base can be moved to different locations.
customer_reviews.author: Robin S.

customer_reviews.title: Decent bell, door remote could be made a little better
customer_reviews.text: Overall it does the job. It could have offered a few more sounds for the money though. My biggest complaint is the cheapness of the door unit, it's very cheap plastic and if you're not careful you can easily strip the snap that connects the two pieces together when you put the battery in resulting in it wanting pop off when someone presses the bell. This came from using a small screwdriver to pop it open as instructed but the plastic is super soft. Had to adjust the mounting screws a little and got lucky to have it stay well enough. Beats having to hardwire another unit though!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great doorbell!
customer_reviews.text: I moved into an apartment and ordered a pizza after a few weeks of living there. Upon receiving a call from an impatient delivery driver I realized I didn't have a doorbell... I got online and ordered this and it has not failed me. I would recommend screwing the back plate into the wall/door frame/side of your house or using a very high end double adhesive. A few different tones and volumes, distance covered is perfect for what I needed it for; I live on the second floor and it works every time.
customer_reviews.author: fryphish

customer_reviews.title: was a good value on sale
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to assemble. With the volume all the way up I can hear it from anywhere in the house. Since it's portable I can also put it on the back deck when I'm working in the back yard. I just left it on the standard ding-dong but it does have a couple other sound options. You can also buy an additional push button(s) for other doors and an icon will blink showing you which door rung. When you mount the push button you'll need to use a drill to get thru the plastic and wood for the tiny screws that hold it in place.
customer_reviews.author: fatcatdeals

customer_reviews.title: Portable door chime
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice addition. I had wanted something to replace our old wired system. It works well..perhaps not as loud, though sound is adjustable, as the old system. Portability is just something I do not look for in a door bell...call me old fashioned. It is attractive, but again I think of a doorbell as something I hear, not something that should be visually appealing. I have only had it less than 2 months, so am still evaluating the length of time the batteries work. To this point we are pleased.
customer_reviews.author: GHBRN

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This has worked well through all seasons (including a blockbuster winter), and my door has no overhang. I was concerned about the doorbell being exposed to the weather, so I cut a tiny piece of tape (I used the white bandage tape you put over gauze to cover a wound) to put on the top of it, to seal any crevices. I don't know if that made a difference or not, but I haven't had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: ILMSAPAMFE

customer_reviews.title: Very Loud - Terrific for People who are Hard of Hearing
customer_reviews.text: I got this bell for my father-in-law who is hard of hearing. This bell is very loud and the range is excellent. Note, that it is nowhere near the 250 feet claimed, but it reaches all over his house. He particularly liked the fact that the receiver is mobile, as it permits him to carry it all over the house. He says he can hear it everywhere on the main floor from the location where it is hung, but it is great to be able to take it into the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Hillel Kaminsky

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these to use in a rental triplex. Push buttons were easy to mount. Best part is that each bell is on a separate frequency so I didn't have to worry about the wrong bell ringing. The three residences are located close together, so that was a major concern. Only drawback is that there are only a few chimes to select from. Not a deal breaker, though. Each resident seems to be fine with one of the available options.
customer_reviews.author: Tsunami

customer_reviews.title: Eats batteries!
customer_reviews.text: After two months, we have had to change the batteries 5 times in the button. They have all been brand new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: osubssw16

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Sturdy and well built too...
customer_reviews.text: OK, it may be just a bit early to write a review, but I've had it for a few months, and it is vastly superior to the previous versions I had (which I admit were at a much lower price point). It's a night and day difference between those (approx. $15 to $20, if I remember correctly, this was a few years ago) and this one. With the cheap ones, they plain as day didn't necessarily ring every single time someone pressed the button, and they certainly didn't last years and years. This is a well build product, upgradable for two doors, etc. should that be an issue for you.
customer_reviews.author: johnxtampa

customer_reviews.title: all chimes sound good. And I was able to put a second ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. Simple to install. Different chimes for the front and back doors, all chimes sound good. And I was able to put a second (chime) unit in my office so I can hear whichever door has a guest, no matter where in the home I am. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: BrooklynBen

customer_reviews.title: The set up is very easy in the doorbell works well
customer_reviews.text: I got this doorbell to replace a wired version of my home so I didn't have to run an extension. The set up is very easy in the doorbell works well. There are different chimes but I'm just using the classic one and the volume control is pretty handy. I don't really like the button it's kind of bulky and doesn't look very classy on the front of my house but the doorbell is very functional and saved me trying to rewire
customer_reviews.author: C. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Now we always can hear the door bell.
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 of them. We have a 3 story house I put an chime on the 1st and 3rd floors. Now we always can hear the door bell. The door chime button is a higher quality than the cheaper chimes. I went through several of those. This button gives a click the cheep ones I tried before fall apart this has been the weakest link before I got the Honeywell. Three months later both receivers started beeping. At random times. I tried new batteries and that made no difference. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: baby boomer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup doorbell system.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great doorbell that I bought for my manager's office (since the door usually remains locked). VERY easy to setup (batteries not included). The front slides off to reveal the volume control. The top of the system has a button to change the doorbell sound. The back of the system has two notches if you want to hang up the unit, or it can stand easily as well. The doorbell button has sticky tape for easy hanging. Good system!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Molixam

customer_reviews.title: loud and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I needed a door bell PRONTO because I had people just barging into my home at all different hours on a daily basis, I had to start locking my doors 24/7. I wanted a door bell that I could use immediately out of the box, this one does the job beautifully, it is loud so even if I am in the basement i can hear it. It would be nice if it was lit at night but thats just an added perk, it looks nice on my door so I am happy with my purchase and would definitely recommend this to anyone who needs a good wireless doorbell.
customer_reviews.author: AMN63

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this for my office and it works great
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my office and it works great! There are only two of us in the large space and sometimes we do not hear when people walk in. My coworker had her purse stolen from the office one day so we decided to keep the office door locked and add a door bell for visitors to use. This was easy to install and use. It is loud enough for us both to hear.
customer_reviews.author: ANE

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Honeywell wireless door chime for my Mom's front and back doors. Wireless front door button already comes with the kit, but I purchase an extra wireless button for her back door. Works great. Buttons mount with double stick tape. Button and chime batteries have lasted 6 months, but not sure how long they will ultimately last. Range is great, back door button is 3 walls away and still works reliably. The sound quality of the chimes is very good, and can be changed to three different notes. Wireless technology at its best..
customer_reviews.author: Scott (Technogeek)Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works; button screws in rather than just being taped on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this doorbell because the button screws into the exterior wall, rather than just sticking on with glorified tape like some of the others. Tape will eventually fail in outdoor applications. Quickly if you live in a wet climate and don't have a roof over your door. It has multiple tones and support for multiple buttons and other fancy stuff that I don't need. I just kept the default tone, set a reasonable volume level, and will never mess with it again until a battery needs replacement.
customer_reviews.author: David Ripton

product_meta.title: Honeywell RCWL300A1006 Premium Portable Wireless Doorbell / Door Chime and Push Button
product_meta.description:
111111

AMAZON.COM
The Honeywell RCWL300A P3 Premium Portable Wireless Door Chime and Push Button makes it easy to replace your home's generic doorbell ring with a chime tune that better fits your individual style. This chime is also compatible with a wide range of optional security accessories that can help you safeguard your home and family, and it comes complete with a pre-programmed bell push button. 

 

Wireless Design for User-Friendly Setup and Operation
The chime's highly portable wireless design lets you take it with you to the patio, your garage workshop, or your home office--wherever you're most likely to hear it. Thanks to its 225-foot working range, you'll can take it with you throughout your home and be sure to never to miss a visitor's arrival. Versatile and Elegant to Match Your Lifestyle
Featuring a sleek, contemporary look that's sure to blend in with your home's decor, the RCWL330A delivers CD-quality sound with fully adjustable volume, giving you complete control over the sound of your door chime. Three distinct tunes are included for you to choose from: Ding Dong, St. Clements, and Westminster.

If you've got an infant or young child in the house, you'll be happy to know that you have the option of turning the chime down or completely off--a great option for nap time.

Décor Wireless Bell Push Button for Convenience
The included RPWL300A Décor Wireless Bell Push Button is a slim, stylish accessory that lets you start using your wireless chime right away. It's crafted from white, UV-resistant plastic that holds its true color longer to preserve the curb appeal of your home. This surface-mount push button offers a feedback LED display and low-battery indicator for easy reference. Its individually coded, self-learning design simplifies programming and helps prevent interference from other users or appliances. This push button comes with the necessary battery.

In case you need an additional bell push button or are looking for a push that matches your door's hardware, the RCWL300A also works with the wide variety of décor pushes that feature "E" compatibility.

Advanced Security Compatibility for Peace of Mind
The chime works with up to six transmitters, allowing you to connect a single chime to push buttons located at different entrances and making it easy to implement a variety of security measures that will quickly alert you if an unwanted guest decides to pay your home a visit.

You have the option of linking this chime to motion detectors or to door contacts that sound a signal anytime targeted doors or windows open or when someone approaches your home. For those with larger homes, there are also extenders available, which can extend the working range of your system (motion detectors, door contacts, and extenders not included).

When using several transmitters, alert lights allow you to visually reference which one has been activated, so you can respond quickly and appropriately.

This door chime operates on three "AA" batteries (not included).

About Honeywell
With over 120 years of trusted reliability, Honeywell International is a diversified technology and manufacturing leader, serving customers worldwide with aerospace products and services; control technologies for buildings, homes and industry; automotive products; turbochargers; and specialty materials.

Whether you're flying on a plane, driving a car, heating or cooling a home, furnishing an apartment, taking medication or playing a sport, Honeywell products touch most peoples' lives everyday. Honeywell technologies are found in more than 150 million homes, 10 million buildings and a multitude of manufacturing plants around the world.

What's in the Box
Wireless door chime, pre-programmed bell push button with CR2032 coin cell battery, mounting hardware, and instructions 





FROM THE MANUFACTURER
A premium door chime from Honeywell with the option of adding on security accessories offering peace of mind and custom upgrade possibilities. Add-on push buttons for other entrances around the home, door and window contacts for added security, or motion detectors for peace of mind inside and out. The RCWL300A incorporates 3 visual alert icons to let you know which device has been triggered with an exclusive event log so you can recall which devices were last triggered in case you missed a call. The product has the flexibility to go wherever you want it, on the wall, on the patio, or in the basement, and the 250-foot operating range provides the performance to work virtually anywhere in your home. CD quality sound and fully adjustable volume round out the features for this door chime plus security product.

See more
feature_bullets: Wireless and operates on 3 LR6 AA alkaline batteries
Works with up to 3 push buttons, motion detectors, or door contacts for added security and convenience
Has three chime tunes, fully adjustable volume, and 3 visual alert icons
Self-learning code system automatically adjusts to eliminate interference

specifications.Included Components: Cr2032 Coin Cell Battery, Mounting Hardware, Instructions, Wireless Door Chime, Pre-Programmed Bell Push Button
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,714 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
